fields.description:
We have Confluence meeting pages we fill in each week with the Jira ticket mentions we discussed. We can query the individual pages however this requires updating our dashboard filters with the new meeting pages each week. We would like to be able to pass the parent page into the jql and the query automatically scans the child pages for Jira ticket mentions.

Something like:

(issue in (issuesWithRemoteLinksByGlobalId("appId=########-####-####-#####-############&ancestor=9601581"))
fields.summary: Querying child pages of confluence page for jira ticket mentions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we have a lot of filters with similar name (e.g. "Filter for board"), the filter may not show when looking for the exact name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create over 50 filter with the pattern "Filter for ABC board" changing the ABC part. (this is done automatically when creating new Software projects.
# Create filter "Filter for board"
# Search for "Filter for board" (without the quotes) when typing a JQL or when creating a Roadmaps Plan

h3. Expected Results
"Filter for board" is the top suggestion

h3. Actual Results
List of suggested filters does not bring "Filter for board" as a suggestion

h3. Workaround
Add the quotes when looking for the filter name
fields.summary: Searching for filter name does not show in list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the indexing thread fails to obtain the write lock for the index, it doesn't log this event. Only when the read lock timeout happens, which by default is 30 seconds, an error is logged with the timeout:

{code}
2020-11-10 15:28:18,570-0300 RMI TCP Connection(64290)-10.22.22.22 ERROR      [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 90000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 90000 milliseconds
{code}

We should log when the thread fails to get the write lock even when an exclusive lock is not requested, including the thread which holds the lock. This makes the troubleshooting easier.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

On environments experiencing I/O throughput problems, it has been observed this problem when large replication/reindex operations are being performed. Such as in SLA updates for JSD projects, which triggers a replication operation. The index file is locked but without analyzing the audit logs it is difficult to understand what is holding the lock for the index. 

h3. Expected Results

When the index is locked and threads are unable to obtain the write lock, the thread holding the lock should be logged and an error about the index write lock failure -- not only when the timeout happens -- at *INFO* level (without requiring any debugging to be enabled). 

As per JRASERVER-63188, it has been implemented logging which prints which tread is holding the write lock only when another thread wants the exclusive lock.

h3. Actual Results

The thread holding the write lock is not logged.
fields.summary: Jira should log the event when thread fails to obtain the write lock at INFO level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the indexing thread fails to obtain the read lock for the index, it doesn't log this event. Only when the read lock timeout happens, which by default is 30 seconds, an error is logged with the timeout:

{code}
2020-11-10 15:28:18,570-0300 RMI TCP Connection(64290)-10.22.22.22 ERROR      [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 90000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 90000 milliseconds
{code}

We should log when the thread fails to get the read lock including the thread which holds the lock. This makes the troubleshooting easier.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

On environments experiencing I/O throughput problems, it has been observed this problem when large replication/reindex operations are being performed. Such as in SLA updates for JSD projects, which triggers a replication operation. The index file is locked but without analyzing the audit logs it is difficult to understand what is holding the lock for the index. 

h3. Expected Results

When the index is locked and threads are unable to obtain the read lock, the thread holding the lock should be logged and an error about the index read lock failure -- not only when the timeout happens -- at *INFO* level (without requiring any debugging to be enabled). As per JRASERVER-63188, it has been implemented logging which prints which tread is holding the write lock only when another thread wants the exclusive lock.

h3. Actual Results

The thread holding the read lock is not logged.
fields.summary: Jira should log the event when thread fails to obtain the read lock at INFO level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using JQL DURING for a future date, results are returned. 

Example: A customer has dashboards set up for the fiscal year and future dates have returned issues. 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run 8.5.1 Jira 
 # Create issues with status IN PROGRESS
 # Run the query with a future date ie. 
 Status WAS IN ("In Progress") DURING (2021-11-01,2021-11-30)

h3. Expected Results

You would expect results to return nothing
h3. Actual Results

Every single issue in the instance that has a status of "In Progress" is returned. 
h3. Workaround

No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Using Future Date for JQL Operator DURING Not Working as Expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira admin while creating new board is not able to select "Project Lead". Jira users are not affected since they have a different window during Board creation.

This a regression in Jira 8.13.1 . The issue is not affecting 8.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1- Create a Board
2- Choose 'Create a Scrum board"
3- Choose "Board crated with new Software project" Click next
4- You can provide "Project name", " Project key" BUT "Project Lead" seems tome mandatory but filed is disabled
5- Note: that after clicking on the button "Create board" to board is created.
6- The setting of the new created project show the current user as "Project Lead"

h3. Expected Results
User can provide a "Project Lead" during Board creation
h3. Actual Results
"Project Lead" field is disabled

h3. Workaround

You can Edit the "Project lead" after the Board creation

1- On 'Project Settings'
2- Click on 'Users and Roles'
3- Click on 'Edit Defaults'
4- You can edit the Project lead
fields.summary: Not able to select "Project Lead" while creating new board

fields.summary: Add support to Java 12

fields.description:
Currently, feature [Running a Bamboo Build when Releasing a Version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+a+Bamboo+Build+when+Releasing+a+Version] runs builds from the main Plan Repository only.

Would be good if from JIRA, the user could choose what branch the Plan should run the build from.
fields.summary: When Releasing a Version in JIRA, allow user to choose Plan Branch

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Service Management has a feature "Customer Request Channel" which indicates where the issue was created (email, the customer portal, the Jira UI, etc.) It would be useful to have a similar feature for comments, and to have this available in non-JSM projects. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add an additional value in the comment section, for example "via Portal/email/JIRA/API". This should apply in all project types (Business, JSM, and Software.)
h3. Why this is important

It is possible to 'spoof' an email to Jira and created a comment from the spoofed email. If an admin knows that a comment is created by email, they can take action against this security issue.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Give visibility on which channel a comment is added

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to modify various resources via a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability, following an Information Disclosure vulnerability in the referrer headers which discloses a user's CSRF token.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.10, and from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.2.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.10
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.10
 * 8.13.1
fields.summary: CSRF token theft through referrer headers - CVE-2021-39126

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When in upgrade mode on 8.13 the dropdowns from the menu bars are offset, presumably by the upgrade banner.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a 8.5.x cluster
# Perform a ZDU upgrade to 8.13
# On the 8.5 nodes click a dropdown menu and observe that it displays correctly
# When an 8.13 node is available but Jira is still in ZDU mode (so the banner is still displayed), click a menu and observe that the dropdown is offset

An 8.5.7 node:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-31 at 12.13.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

An 8.13 node:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-31 at 2.02.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The dropdown is not offset

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown is offset

h3. Workaround
There is no current workaround, but the issue is temporary. Once the upgrade is finalised and the banner no longer displays, the dropdowns are no longer offset.
fields.summary: When in upgrade mode on Jira 8.13 the dropdowns from the menu bars are offset by the banner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The CSV import validator does not validate required fields.

When the user tried to proceed with the CSV import without required fields, Jira returns a "Fatal error during import".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a required field for an issue type in a project
 # Build a CSV to import that issue type into that project without that required column
 # Validate the import and see Jira finds no issues
 # Proceed with the import and see Jira fails with Fatal error

h3. Expected Results

The validator should warn the user required fields are missing.

Or the error should be more clear as to _what_ caused the error.
h3. Actual Results

Jira fails the import with "Fatal error during import".

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-10-20 13:42:32,844-0400 JiraTaskExecutionThread-1909 ERROR username 822x9238993x6 v109gb 10.10.10.10 /secure/ImporterLogsPage%21import.jspa [c.a.j.p.i.i.b.e.BulkCreateDataImporter$ValidableFileImportLoggerThread[https-jsse-nio-8443-exec-9 url:/issues/secure/...Page%21import.jspa username:n1503176,5,main]] Fatal error during import java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.bulkcreate.engine.BulkCreateDataImporter.doImportIssues(BulkCreateDataImporter.java:235) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.bulkcreate.engine.BulkCreateDataImporter.runImporterEngine(BulkCreateDataImporter.java:172) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.bulkcreate.engine.BulkCreateDataImporter.doImport(BulkCreateDataImporter.java:147)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Try to create the same issue type on that same project manually through Jira's interface. See if there's any required field that's not present in the CSV or hasn't been mapped during the import.

 

Similar to JRASERVER-64670.
fields.summary: CSV import validator does not validate required fields that result in Fatal error during import

fields.description:
Issue Summary
 Adding Jira Issues Dates event types to Team Calendars is extremely non performant, and can cause outages by consuming threads that can take hours to return. It causes high CPU on the processing nodes which can also result in performance impacts and system outages, as system resources cannot be used to respond to other requests.

This issue was recently resolved in Jira Cloud by upgrading the Fortuna ical library. The issue is caused by the library creating thousands of date objects per date, and checking each against a call to the system date, to determine timezones.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Confluence and Jira
 # Create a custom field in JIRA of time Date/Time Picker.
 # Set this field for a few issues (5 was enough for production instance).
 # In Confluence open Calendars and add a new calendar
 # Click '...' and Add event
 # Select Jira Issue Dates, and the Jira project with the custom fields you set
 # Select some date fields including the custom field you created and submit
 # It will take a long time to add the events, or if the project is large they may never be added to the calendar

h4. Jira only
 # Create a custom field in JIRA of time Date/Time Picker.
 # Set this field for a few issues (5 was enough for production instance).
 # Call {{/rest/ical/1.0/ical/config/fields?jql=project=<project_key>}} Jira endpoint to find out the custom field id (customfield_XXXXX).
 # Call {{/rest/ical/1.0/ical/search/jql/events.ics?jql=project+%3D+%22<project_key>%22&dateFieldName=<custom_field_id>&includeFixVersions=false&start=1598572800000&end=1609977600000&maxIssue=1000}} endpoint to retrieve a list of events in iCal format (set Jira project key, custom field id, and start/stop timestamps in parameters). Events are generated based on the value of the custom field. So make sure that this date is within the timeframe set by start and end arguments.
 # You will see a 20+ second delay even though the number of issues/events is small.

h3. Expected Results

Requests to Jira REST endpoints return in a timely manner.
h3. Actual Results

Threads are consumed and don't return for hours, and cause high CPU, which leads to performance degradation and outages.

There is no exception in the logfile as the threads are still processing. However, threads similar to those below will be visible in thread dumps:
{code:java}
http-nio-8080-exec-1 url:/rest/ical/1.0/...rch/jql/events.ics

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
{code}
h3. Notes

Currently we are aware of couple of problems related to *ical4j*:
 # High CPU load (current ticket - JRASERVER-71803)
 ** this is a contention due to frequent {{getProperty}} calls
 # Thread being blocked/stuck trying to contact [http://tzurl.org|http://tzurl.org/], this is not related to current ticket
 ** this is a contention in the network and there is a feature flag to prevent the call by disabling the TZ update definition (see [https://ical4j.github.io/ical4j-user-guide/timezones/] for more details), to do that:
 ** Set the property "_-Dnet.fortuna.ical4j.timezone.update.enabled=false_" on [Jira startup options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html].
 ** Restart Jira

h3. Workaround
 * Restarting the affected nodes kills the threads and will return the system to performing normally.
 * * As an extreme measure, the {{/rest/ical/1.0/ical/search/jql/events.ics}} REST endpoint can be blocked at the proxy layer (or disable "JIRA iCalendar Plugin"). This will break Team Calendar functionality that relies on this endpoint.

h3. Resolution

Upgrade to Jira 8.15 once it is released.

Alternatively, for Jiras on {{8.5.10}} and above, update {{Jira iCalendar Plugin}} through the Universal Plugin Manager
 # Go to Admin > Manage Apps
 # Search for {{JIRA iCalendar Plugin}} (you may need to expand the list to All Apps)
 # Confirm there is an update to {{v1.8.2}} or above
 # Click Update
fields.summary: Adding Jira Issues Dates event types to Team Calendars is extremely non performant

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When there is a time discrepancy between one (or more) Jira node and the ADFS server clock, the Jira Data Center SSO feature won't work as expected:
{noformat}
2020-10-26 07:50:04,134-0700 https-openssl-nio-8443-exec-7 ERROR Munjal.Patel 470x91x1 10d1uul 172.20.23.124 /plugins/servlet/samlconsumer [c.o.saml2.authn.SamlResponse] Timing issues (please check your clock settings)
2020-10-26 07:50:04,134-0700 https-openssl-nio-8443-exec-7 ERROR Munjal.Patel 470x91x1 10d1uul 172.20.23.124 /plugins/servlet/samlconsumer [c.onelogin.saml2.Auth] processResponse error. invalid_response
2020-10-26 07:50:04,134-0700 https-openssl-nio-8443-exec-7 WARN Munjal.Patel 470x91x1 10d1uul 172.20.23.124 /plugins/servlet/samlconsumer [c.a.p.a.i.web.saml.SamlConsumerServlet] Received an invalid SamlResponse: com.atlassian.plugins.authentication.impl.web.saml.provider.InvalidSamlResponse: Received invalid SAML response: Timing issues (please check your clock settings)
{noformat}
h3. Suggested Resolution

Add a health check to DC Server to check the skew between Jira and the ADFS.
h3. Workaround
 * *Run the following commands on Linux:*
$ _sudo apt-get install ntp_ (use '_yum install ntp'_ for CentOS or Redhat)
$ _sudo service ntp stop_
$ _sudo ntpdate -s [time.nist.gov|http://time.nist.gov/]_ (we can use any other server from [here|http://www.pool.ntp.org/en/].
$ _sudo service ntp start_

 
 * *Run the following command on MacOS X:*
$ _sudo ntpdate -u_ _[time.apple.com|http://time.apple.com/]_

 
 * *Do the following on Windows:*
_- Click on your date/time in the bottom right -> Change date and time settings... -> Update now_
_- The default server is set to [time.windows.com|http://time.windows.com/]_
fields.summary: As an Jira Administrator I want Health Check to check the clock skew between Jira and the ADFS

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

+*This is a regression from Jira 8.5.*+

JIRA "Create Project with Shared Configuration" should allow Jira Admins to select the Previously created projects from the dropdown without the additional granting of "Browse Project Permissions". 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 *  Set-up new Jira Instance (Tested with 8.13)
 * Create a test project
 * Now Remove the browse project permission for this project.
 * Try to create another project with a shared configuration

h3. Expected Results

The earlier created project should be visible from the dropdown just like in version 8.5.
(Please refer to the screenshot *Create Projects from Shared Configuration_8.5.png.* It was working as expected in Jira 8.5)
h3. Actual Results

Projects are not visible due to lack of "Browse Projects Permission"
(Please refer to *Issue with Jira 8.13.png*)
h3. Workaround

It is required to Grant the "Browse Project Permission" so that the template would be visible from the selection dropdown.
fields.summary: JIRA "Create Project with Shared Configuration" should allow Jira Admins to select the Previously created projects from the dropdown without the additional granting of "Browse Project Permissions".

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After running the Integrity Checker selecting the option "Check that all Issue Links are associated with valid issues", some issue links return with the following error:
{code:java}
ERROR: The following Issue Link will be removed due to a related invalid issue: IssueLink (ID:<issue_link>).{code}
(flag) If we run the Integrity Checker again (without clicking on "FIX" button), it doesn't report the same issue links.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

We suspect the issue happens in huge instances with millions of issues that use Scriptrunner or any scripts to manage issue links.

 
h3. Expected Results

Health issue links not been shown as broken in the Integrity Checker.
h3. Actual Results

Issue links without problems are temporarily shown as broken in the integrity Checker.
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-12 at 18.21.23 1-1.png|width=440,height=180! 
  
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Issuelink health check on the Integrity Checker is incorrectly reporting issue links as broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Accessibility issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to backlog
 # Tab through elements

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As part of the Jira health check analysis, the Troubleshooting and Support Plugin checks the support status of a product on today's date and gets Jira's release dates from the MarketPlace.

However, the JSON file returned by the MarketPlace does not contain all Jira releases and we can observe the following messages at the EOL check:
7.6.4: Unable to verify the End of Life date for version '7.6.x'. The check has not been performed.
7.11.2 and beyond: We couldn't verify the End of Life date for JIRA version 7.11.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Using a JIRA 8.10.0 version, access the Admin > System > Troubleshooting and support tools
* At the "Instance health" tab, expand "Supported Platforms" and "End of Life"
* Observe that check was successful and the product had not reached the EOL
* Redo the steps using Jira 8.8.1 version.

h3. Expected Results
* Check was successful and the product had not reached the EOL

h3. Actual Results
* The EOL check was not executed and the following message was presented:
*We couldn't verify the End of Life date for JIRA version 8.8.1.*

JSON returned by the Market Place does not contain all the versions

h3. Workaround
Update the troubleshooting plugin to the latest version.
fields.summary: Health check cannot verify the End of Life date for JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user attempts to traverse the 'More' menu in the Issue View using keyboard navigation, they cannot select options below/after 'Attach Files.'
h5. Additional Details

At some point, the [Attach Screenshot|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disabling-jira-screenshot-applet-361726321.html] option was hidden in the 'More' menu of the Issue View. Upon further research, we find that this option appears tied to the 'Attach screenshot to this issue (show-attach-screenshot-popup-button)' module in the Jira Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin. If this specific module is disabled, keyboard navigation past the 'Attach Files' option works.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to the Issue View of any JIRA issue.
 # Use the Tab key to navigate to and select the 'More' menu.
 # Use the Down Arrow key to attempt to navigate to an option in the list below 'Attach Files.'

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to reach and select an option like 'Add vote,' 'Create sub-task,' etc. using your keyboard.
h3. Actual Results

The options below 'Attach files' are inaccessible via keyboard navigation.
h3. Workaround
h5. Option 1
Disable the 'Attach screenshot to this issue (show-attach-screenshot-popup-button)' module under the Jira Drag and Drop Attachment Plugin in the JIRA Administration (cog icon) -> Manage apps tab -> Manage apps page.
(!) You will need to filter by 'System' plugins in order to find it; as this is a built-in Atlassian plugin.
(flag) This could limit endusers' options for uploading attachments easily (i.e., through drag-and-drop). 

h5. Option 2
A customization to override this behavior has been identified using the Scriptrunner plugin:
# Navigate to Manage Apps -> Script Runner -> Script Fragments
# Click on Create Script Fragment and select Show a Web Panel
# Select atl.jira.view.issue.right.context and enter the following code to the Provider class / script section: {code}writer.write("<script>\$('#attach-screenshot-html5').attr('hidden','true'); JIRA.bind(JIRA.Events.ISSUE_REFRESHED, function (e, context, reason) { \$('#attach-screenshot-html5').attr('hidden','true');});</script>") {code}
# Click save. 

(i) This resolves the navigation issue without impacting endusers' ability to drag-and-drop attachments.
fields.summary: Hidden "Attach Screenshot" option in "More" menu breaks keyboard navigation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Starting on Jira 8.7, we can no longer edit labels if the field is removed from screens, however, +we still can reach the label's dialogue and add a label when we press the "L" key.+ 

While makes sense that after removing the labels field from the screen we can no longer edit it, it is still a contradiction that we can edit the same field using the short key "L". 

Reviewing the issue JRASERVER-28788, Nick Menere [Atlassian] (Inactive) added a comment - 23/Jul/2012 1:38 AM states:
{quote}We aren’t ignoring the setting. Any time the screen is used (except in view issue) it will only show fields defined on the screen.
 The problem is occurring because we calculate whether a field can be inline edited by checking if it appears on the edit screen. This is wrong for labels. It should be defined by whether they have permission to edit labels for an issue. (as it used to work).
{quote}
Later on, at the same issue JRASERVER-28788, David Elkan (Inactive) added a comment - 07/Aug/2012 3:41 AM explaining:
{quote}I’m sorry to say this however we won’t be able to bring back the edit button for the Labels field unless it is in the active Edit Screen. Instead the Labels field will operate as any other field and respect the Edit Screen configuration on the View Issue page.
 To make the Labels field inline editable it must be added to the active Edit Screen. Also, as discussed above, you can press the ‘L’ key to bring up the Edit Labels dialog.
 The issue JRA-28243 will track the creation of a Knowledge Base entry to cover ways to work around this issue in future.
{quote}
This was said for Jira 5.1, however, the Labels field was visible up to Jira 7.13.8, then on 8.0, it was not more visible.

What’s the indented design, shall labels be editable inline on issue views?

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using Jira 8.0 or above, remove the Labels field from the screen used to view an issue type, for instance, bug
 # Create a new issue
 # View the issue
 # Hover the Labels field

h3. Expected Results

The pencil would be presented and we would be able to add a new label
h3. Actual Results

Labels files are not editable 
h3. Workaround

Pressing the "L" key opens the Labels dialogue and you can edit the label.
fields.summary: what’s the indented design, shall labels be editable inline on issue views?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a background reindex in Jira 8.13, it is slower than background reindex operations in older Jira versions (in this example, we used 8.8.1).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy Jira 8.13 & Jira 8.8.1
 # Use data generator to create 60k+ issues with ~15 comments each
 # Perform a lock and reindex operation on both instances (as background reindex won't be available due to the discrepancies between the jiraissue table and the index issue count)
 # Perform a background reindex and compare the results between them

h3. Expected Results

The time to complete the reindex should be similar between two Jira instances in the same product release (8 in this case).  

h3. Actual Results

Jira 8.13 takes at least twice the time. 


h3. Not a bug.
After upgrading to JIRA 8.10.0 and later, including the LTS release 8.13.0, the new background reindex process *works differently*. All index updates are checking the version of the entity in the index. This *guarantees index consistency when there are concurrent index updates*. Previously, any concurrent user actions modifying those entities would be potentially overwritten (in the index) by the old data. So a task was executed in the end of the background re-index process to try to fix that possible inconsistent index.

However, with versioning background reindex introduced in Jira 8.10, we do a conditional update when updating the index like any other user action modifying the index. Thus we have a consistent index but with a _slightly higher cost_. This check happens for each item and during this, the index is constantly flushed to the disk.

Further information has been provided at the KB below: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/background-reindex-is-slow-after-upgrading-to-jira-8-10-and-later-1027126085.html

Also, please check JRASERVER-72196 for some improvement in this area.
fields.summary: Background reindex may be slower in Jira 8.13

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Jira uses a number of different ORM / library to write and execute SQL query. To enable debug, originally Jira shipped with a "SQL Logging" feature, quick provided an "enable/disable" toggle. This toggle write SQL query to atlassian-jira-sql.log file for any query executed with *ofbiz*

Queries executed with other libraries will take no effect for this setting.
 * ActiveObjects - used by Jira and third party plugins
 * QueryDSL - used by Atlassian and third party plugins, for example, Advanced Roadmaps for Jira (formerly Portfolio)

The user has to know these package names and add them manually into the _Add another package_ screen
h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the SQL Debug options to include
 *  [  ] SQL Logging (ofbiz)
 *  [  ] SQL Trace Logging (ofbiz)
 *  [  ] ActiveObjects SQL logging
 *  [  ] QueryDSL logging

Write these out into individual logs:
 * ofbiz - atlassian-jira-sql.log
 * querydsl - atlassian-jira-sql-querydsl.log
 ** {{com.querydsl.sql}}
 * ActiveObjects - atlassian-jira-sql-ao.log
 ** {{net.java.ao.sql}}
fields.summary: Improve SQL Debugging configurability

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Jira application does not allow to add duplicate values to the name of an issuelinktype  (linkname column) through the Jira user interface nor through the Jira REST API. However it is still possible to add duplicate {{issuelinktype.linkname}} values by performing direct SQL insert or update statements.

It is important to note that having duplicate issuelinktype names (issuelinktype.linkname) can cause some operations such as exporting issues to CSV files to fail.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please add a unique constrain on the {{linkname}} column of the {{issuelinktype}} table.

\\
*Additional Comments*

* Please note that this suggestions aims to keep consistency with the approach already taken in the Jira aplication and enforced in the Jira user interface and REST API.
* The described problem was found in Jira 8.5 and it is expected to be also present in previous Jira versions. 

{{issuelinktype}} table description:
 {noformat}
         Table "public.issuelinktype"
  Column  |          Type          | Modifiers
----------+------------------------+-----------
 id       | numeric(18,0)          | not null
 linkname | character varying(255) |
 inward   | character varying(255) |
 outward  | character varying(255) |
 pstyle   | character varying(60)  |
Indexes:
    "pk_issuelinktype" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "linktypename" btree (linkname)
    "linktypestyle" btree (pstyle)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Add a unique constraint to the issuelinktype table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When custom POP3/IMAP servers are being used to handle the incoming mail, trying to change the password through Jira UI will result in the error message:
{noformat}
Unfortunately no connection was possible. Review the errors below and rectify:AuthenticationFailedException: LOGIN failed. Invalid login/password for user id <username> {noformat}
If debugging the connection from the mail server side, it can be seen that Jira submits the original password and not the new one. This makes it impossible to update the mail server password should there be a need for it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Greenmail as a test mail server and set a user with a password:
 {noformat}java -Dgreenmail.setup.test.all -Dgreenmail.users=catchall:abc -Dgreenmail.verbose -jar greenmail-standalone-1.6.0.jar{noformat}
 # Configure POP3 or IMAP server in Jira pointing to Greenmail (host=localhost, port=3110 for POP3)
# Test connection, make sure it works, save.
# Try editing the connection, enable "Change password", and provide whatever password. When testing, the connection will be successful all the time.
# Restart Greenmail with a new password:
 {noformat}java -Dgreenmail.setup.test.all -Dgreenmail.users=catchall:123 -Dgreenmail.verbose -jar greenmail-standalone-1.6.0.jar{noformat}
# Edit the mail server, try providing the new password, it will never work.
# Observe Greenmail output and see that Jira is supplying the original password when testing the connection.

h3. Expected Results

New password is successfully set.
h3. Actual Results

New password is completely ignored and never set.
h3. Workaround

The easiest workaround is to never rotate passwords for the mail server. If that is not possible, you can do one of the following:
- Delete this mail server, and create it a new. You will need to repoint all mail handlers to the new mail server.
- Update the password directly in the database, encoding it with a [base64 encoding|https://www.base64encode.org/]:
{code:sql}UPDATE mailserver SET mailpassword='<base64-encoded password>' WHERE name = '<mail server name in Jira>';{code}
fields.summary: Updating incoming mail server password does not work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The cache replication in Jira Data Center 7.9 and later is asynchronous by default, which means that cache modifications aren’t replicated to other nodes immediately after they occur, but are instead added to local queues. They are then replicated in the background based on their order in the queue. 
There is an option to "disable the asynchronous cache replication", and enables the synchronous one instead (used in Jira 7.8 and earlier) which can be used as a fallback scenario. 

See related docs: https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-cache-replication-954262828.html

Taking into account that option was rarely used and it complicates the code (see JRASERVER-71160), removing the synchronous code will be beneficial. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove support for synchronous cache replication (make cache replication in Jira Data Center always asynchronous).
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Make cache replication in Jira Data Center always asynchronous

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a customer uses a JQL search where some issues don't exist, the result is different if they have more than 25 issue keys.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Step 1
Create a JQL query with 25 keys 
 Make sure that at least one of the issue keys does not exist.
 *Example: This query has 25 Keys. PROJ-88 doesn't exist.* 
 key in (PROJ-1, PROJ-2, PROJ-3, PROJ-4, PROJ-5, PROJ-6, PROJ-7, PROJ-8, PROJ-9, PROJ-10, PROJ-11, PROJ-12, PROJ-13, PROJ-14, PROJ-15, PROJ-16, PROJ-17, PROJ-18, PROJ-19, PROJ-20, PROJ-21, PROJ-22, PROJ-23, PROJ-24, PROJ-88)
 *Results of Query*

No results are returned and an error is shown.
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-30 at 4.16.20 PM.png|width=629,height=85!

Step 2

Create a JQL query with 26 keys or more.
 Make sure that at least one of the issue keys does not exist.
 *Example: This query has 26 Keys. PROJ-88 doesn't exist.* 
 key in (PROJ-1, PROJ-2, PROJ-3, PROJ-4, PROJ-5, PROJ-6, PROJ-7, PROJ-8, PROJ-9, PROJ-10, PROJ-11, PROJ-12, PROJ-13, PROJ-14, PROJ-15, PROJ-16, PROJ-17, PROJ-18, PROJ-19, PROJ-20, PROJ-21, PROJ-22, PROJ-23, PROJ-24, PROJ-25, PROJ-88)
 *Results of Query*

No error is shown and all results are returned except those that don't exist. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-30 at 4.20.55 PM.png|width=695,height=73!
h3. Expected Results

JQL searches should be consistent regardless of how many keys are searched. Allow JQL searches with 25 keys or less to skip validation and show no error like searches with 26 keys or greater
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown if 25 keys or less are used in the search. If 26 or more keys are used an error is not shown. 
 *The customer would like no errors to show regardless of query size.*

*Related Suggestion Requests*

(JRASERVER-40245) Allow JQL searches via the Issue Navigator to skip validation and return partial results
 (JRASERVER-23287) Searching for an issue key that doesn't exist with JQL should not cause a query/validation error.
h3. Workaround

If you don't want JQL to break when having an issue that doesn't exist, make the query longer than 25 keys. Issues that do exist will be returned and those that don't will be left out.
fields.summary: JQL search with 25 keys vs 26 keys results in different behavior when an issue doesn't exist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Note that this bug affects Jira DC only.

In Jira 8.10.0 we added versioning of Jira entities: issues, comments, worklogs.

From now on every index operation replayed by other nodes contains also the version of entity which is requested to be re-indexed by other nodes.

It is possible that comments/worklogs re-index request may be added without version (i.e. version = 0).

(i) If you see this WARNING in Jira 8.10.x, 8.11.x, 8.12.x, 8.13.0, 8.13.1 in the context of comments or worklogs ({{affectedIndex=COMMENT}} or {{affectedIndex=WORKLOG}}), you can safely ignore it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with comments in Jira not supporting versioning (< 8.10.0)
 # After upgrading to Jira supporting versioning (>= 8.10) trigger an action which re-indexes the whole issue with related entities (example: in 8.11 - 8.13.2 link this issue with another issue)
 ## this will trigger re-indexing of all comments and produce an index replicated operation for those comments created before upgrading with version 0
 ## when other nodes replay this indexing operation the following WARN should be logged:

{noformat}
WARN [INDEX-REPLAY] Unexpected un-versioned operation added for processing: ReplicatedIndexOperation {indexTime=2020-09-18 09:01:34.136, id=3813938, nodeId='node1', affectedIdToVersion={85040=0, 90614=0, 86326=0, 85894=0, 90377=0, 85258=0}, operation=UPDATE, affectedIndex=COMMENT, entityType=NONE, backupFilename=''}{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

Do not log WARNs for legal flows. 
h3. Actual Results

The below message is logged in {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
WARN [INDEX-REPLAY] Unexpected un-versioned operation added for processing: ReplicatedIndexOperation
{noformat}
h3. Related

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/WARN%3A+Unexpected+un-versioned+operation+added+for+processing]
fields.summary: WARN: Unexpected un-versioned operation added for processing ... for comments&worklogs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User name will be displayed with # keyword

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Batched notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-email-notifications-938847633.html#Configuringemailnotifications-batching] is configured as a site-wide configuration. Batched notification is beneficial for some users to reduce email frequency, but others still want to receive each update by non-batched email as they manage notifications with email client threading feature. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Let individual users choose batched notification is preferred or not.
fields.summary: Make batching notification configurable by individual user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[Jira - Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] includes support for MySQL 8.0 and MySQL 5.7 as of Jira 8.13 (Long Term Support release).
 * If you’re creating your own deployment in AWS or Azure, you can use any configuration (e.g. OS or database) that’s supported both by Jira and AWS/Azure.

Currently, Jira platform doesn't support "Azure Database for MySQL".  This results in the following ERRORs during start of the Jira:
{code:xml}
ERROR [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] We've found an error in MySQL supported version!
ERROR [c.a.jira.health.HealthChecks] The database type in your dbconfig.xml is set up to MySQL 8.0 and your MySQL version is different. Consider using MySQL 8.0 database type instead
See our documentation for more information on changing database type.
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for "Azure Database for MySQL"

h3. Notes
The MySQL gateway in Azure reflects lower, unsupported MySQL versions while backend database that serves the application is running a supported version, for example MySQL 8.0.15. This creates inconsistency for version reported to Jira and as a consequence that version reported as unsupported. 

[Supported Azure Database for MySQL server versions|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/mysql/concepts-supported-versions] documents this topic:
{panel:title=Note from Supported Azure Database for MySQL server versions|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#a7c7f9|bgColor=#eff3f9}
In the service, a gateway is used to redirect the connections to server instances. After the connection is established, the MySQL client displays the version of MySQL set in the gateway, not the actual version running on your MySQL server instance. To determine the version of your MySQL server instance, use the SELECT VERSION(); command at the MySQL prompt.
{panel}
fields.summary: Support for Azure Database for MySQL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Even though it is possible to prepopulate the URLs using MDM, it is not possible to restrict the URLs the app can connect to. This might introduce security concerns in some cases. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a feature allowing MDM settings to restrict the URLs the mobile app can connect to.
fields.summary: Implement MDM capabilities to restrict the URLs the mobile app can connect to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing issue search view in Jira 8.13, a redundant vertical scrollbar appears (only when there is additional banner visible - here we have banner informing about administrative functions):

!Screen Shot 2020-10-28 at 12.27.59 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.13
 # Add a couple of sample projects
 # Go to the issue search

h3. Expected Results

Only one vertical scrollbar appears in the view on the right side.
h3. Actual Results

Jira renders two scrollbars.
h3. Workaround

Adding the following custom configuration to the Announcement banner removes the extra scrollbar:
{code:html}
<style>.page-type-navigator {overflow-y: hidden;}</style>{code}
fields.summary: Redundant vertical scrollbar appears in the issue search view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding many project permissions at once overlaps with "Grant" button and the window is not scrollable.

This can be reproduced when there are many permissions to be added at once, so the content will overlap with the "Grant" button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Zoom the browser page to 125% or more
# Go to Jira settings > Issues > Permission schemes > Permissions > Grant permissions
# Add all the permissions from the list

h3. Expected Results
When many permissions are added, the content in the opened window can be scrolled through:
 !image-2020-10-28-11-40-18-423.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The added permissions overlap with "Grant" button and the content is moved out of the window:
 !image-2020-10-28-11-41-00-547.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Bulk add permissions in more batches, so that each set of permission does not hide the "Grant" button.

h3. Notes
* Not reproducible in earlier Jira 8.x versions (tested with 8.5.5)
* Zooming out the browser page will make the "Grant" button visible, but the button will only take effect if found inside the pop-up window. With that said, admin must remove some permissions on the screen to force "Grant" button inside the pop-up window, and only then clicking on the button will work.
fields.summary: Adding many project permissions at once overlaps with "Grant" button and the window is not scrollable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When previewing an image (after clicking on it), it is impossible to exit the preview mode when clicking the grey/dark zone outside the image.

h3. Notes
- this issue was replicated on Jira 8.13.0 and Jira 8.4.2
- this issue might not occur right away, and might only happen after refreshing the Jira issue several times in the browser, as you can see in the screen recording attached to this ticket:
 [^Bug Screen Recording .mov] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open this ticket- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41825 in a new incognito window
# Go to the attachments section
# Click on the first attachment
# Once it is open, click the grey/dark zone outside the image
# At this point, you might be able to exit the image preview mode
# Now, refresh the ticket at least 1 or 2 times in your browser
# Click again on the first attachment
# Once it is open, click the grey/dark zone outside the image


h3. Expected Results

We should be able to exit the image preview mode and go back to the issue view.

h3. Actual Results

When clicking the dark zone around the image, nothing happens. We can't exit the image preview mode:
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-10 at 3.35.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There are few ways to get out of the image preview:
- Click the "X" icon on the top right
- Press the "Esc" key
fields.summary: Can't exit the image preview mode when clicking the gray/dark zone around an image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

System functionalities like editing permissions, starting scripts, are failing to pop up the modal window in the browser. There are DOMExceptions with blocked iframe, however the domain is the same on the base URL and the resources failing to load. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

You have to have an iframe present on the page. eg. go to https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-an-announcement-banner-938846985.html and add 
{code}
<iframe id="cross-origin-iframe" style="height: 200px;" src="http://example.com"></iframe>
{code}
Then go to pages listed below and trigger error.

A few examples where this problem occurs:

# in Admin UI, click on a Manage Permissions - Edit link, or Grant Permissions button
# on Sprints page, click on Start Sprint button
# JSD ticket image attachment functionality and the ability to edit comments on JSD tickets.

h3. Expected Results

The modal window appears for the action. The resources would load normally and there is no related javascript error.

h3. Actual Results

No modal window appears. Javascript errors appear in the browser console.

(The reason for that is that AUI searches for "trigger" - also in iframes JS doesn't have permissions to)

{code}
Exception: Uncaught SecurityError: Blocked a frame with origin "https://jira.xyz.com" from accessing a cross-origin frame.
Resource: \[https://jira.xyz.com/s/fd44c725dede11cd9aef9ad71292ba77-CDN/\-3neea2/813000/acf4d847655d562ba7b8859ec9c6bf09/0de23a335536ffdf539e9fb39a318679/\_/download/contextbatch/js/\_super/batch.js?locale=en-US|https://jira.xyz.com/s/fd44c725dede11cd9aef9ad71292ba77-CDN/3neea2/813000/acf4d847655d562ba7b8859ec9c6bf09/0de23a335536ffdf539e9fb39a318679//download/contextbatch/js/\_super/batch.js?locale=en-US]
Line: 319
Column: 751
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 \(Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64\) AppleWebKit/537.36 \(KHTML, like Gecko\) Chrome/86.0.4240.111 Safari/537.36
Stack trace
{code}

Application logs will also show related errors:
{code}
2020-10-26 10:29:48,213+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-151 url:/browse/HAN-3352 username:012345 url:/secure/Project...ewWithSidebar.jspa username:012345 ERROR 012345 629x971650x1 tafjdr 51.175.141.225,10.210.229.52 /browse/HAN-3352 [c.q.q.plugins.services.PropertiesService] Cannot show iframe due to unknown error
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Only PUT or POST methods accept a request body.
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkState(Preconditions.java:507)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.addRequestParameters(HttpClientRequest.java:176)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.addRequestParameters(HttpClientRequest.java:47)
	at com.qas.qtest.plugins.services.PropertiesService.shouldDisplay(PropertiesService.java:70)
	at com.qas.qtest.plugins.webpanel.TestRunLinkCondition.shouldDisplay(TestRunLinkCondition.java:19)
	{code}

h3. Workaround

As mentioned in [AUI-5256|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AUI-5256], AUI's trigger module may throw a DOMException when access to the iframe's document is denied. To work around it, upgrade to the latest AUI plugin in your Jira instance and verify if it solves your problem: [AUI Plugin 9.1.1|https://packages.atlassian.com/maven-public-local/com/atlassian/aui/auiplugin/9.1.1/auiplugin-9.1.1.jar].
fields.summary: Modal windows fail to appear on front-end when a cross-origin iframe is present on a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After cloning an issue with a custom multi user picker field that had default values, the new (clone) issue will still suggest default values that were set yet at the time when the source issue was created

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom multi user picker field in JIRA; configure the default values to be 'user 1' and 'user 2'; Don't assign that custom field to any screens
# Create a screen with that field, don't assign it to anything
# In a project, pick a workflow and add a status, let's say "new status" that will have the screen created above as a transition view; Publish the workflow
# In that same project - create an issue; For example 'issue 1'; Verify via the export in printable that the new custom field has no values assigned; Attempt to perform that new transition to verify that the default values 'User 1' and 'User 2' are suggested; Don't perform the transition, cancel and re-verify that the new field still has no values (i.e. via export of the Issue 1 in 'printable' mode
# Now change the custom field configuration default values to 'User 3' and 'User 4'
# Clone "Issue 1" to a new issue
# In that cloned issue, attempt to perform the new transition

h3. Expected Results

The new default values 'User 3' and 'User 4' should be suggested for the new issue

h3. Actual Results

The default values set for the 'source' issue are suggested, i.e. 'User 1' and 'User 2'
So technically, in that scenario JIRA doesn't respect the default values configuration for the cloned issues

h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: After cloning an issue, previous default values are suggested for a multi user custom field

fields.description:
We are seeing mentions of Bitbucket in the Jira logs, when we are not even connected to Bitbucket. We are only connected to Github. This appears as the reference is being used in one of the following DVCS classes, somewhere deep down in the code:
c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositorySyncServiceImpl
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.dvcs.service


{code:java}
 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner [c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositorySyncServiceImpl] Repo list had updates when DB reconciled with bitbucket. 
:
:
referencing GitHub Repositories... 
:

{code}

This is causing confusions among our customers as they wonder why the log which is for Github repositories, it is referencing Bitbucket when they have never had Bitbucket connected to their instance. 

There is no workaround at this point.
fields.summary: Reference to bitbucket in Jira logs, when using Github and not Bitbucket.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For example, associating a new issue type to an existing workflow scheme that applies to 2,000 projects has been observed to take days to complete

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Have a workflow scheme that applies to 2,000 projects
 * Associate new issue type to this workflow scheme
**  !add-issue-type.png|thumbnail! 
* Confirm
**  !add-issue-type-confirm.png|thumbnail! 
*  Timeout and error occurs as the initial progress URL includes 2,000 project ids which exceeds the URL limit of Tomcat, see HAR file 
* Removing 2,000 project id parameters from the URL allows progress to be seen: http://10.125.90.70/jira/secure/project/SelectProjectWorkflowSchemeStep3.jspa?taskId=10700&draftMigration=true&schemeId=10103
**  !add-issue-type-progress.png|thumbnail! 
* After an hour the workflow migration tasks was working on projects starting with AC*, about 2% complete


h3. Expected Results

*  Workflow scheme modifications should never take more than a few hours, even if they apply to a large amount of projects. 
* Attempting to view progress should not result in an error

h3. Actual Results
* We have reports of associating a new issue type to an existing workflow scheme taking 2 weeks to complete
* Viewing progress of a workflow scheme modification requires shortening the URL

 [^add-issuetype-journey.har] 
h3. Workaround

While the background process can take a long time to complete it is not resource intensive and will not cause performance issues. Do not restart Jira until this process completes however
fields.summary: Modifying workflow schemes that applies to hundreds or thousands of projects can take up to 2 weeks to complete

fields.description:
Customers using AWS Cloudformation with our Atlassian's script are setting autoscaling nodes for HA.

The servers are automatically created and configured and are running the embedded java. 

There is no option to customize the script to install openjdk instead of using the embedded JRE and we do not have documentation explaining how to change this at Atlassian's script for the autoscaling nodes.
fields.summary: Adapt AWS template used for Jira Install to allow Customer selection of JRE or OpenJDK

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The default Oracle JDBC driver fetch size (10) might cause more roundtrips to DB and this leads to a longer time to fetch results from queries executed on an Oracle DB, which results in slowness for users when loading pages and performing actions in Jira. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Ship Jira with larger _defaultRowPrefetch_ size. This can improve specific operations x4-x6 times.

h3. Workaround 
Apply the changes manually from KB [Using the default Oracle JDBC fetch size may lead to performance issues in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-the-default-oracle-jdbc-fetch-size-may-lead-to-performance-issues-in-jira-1014278793.html]
fields.summary: Increase the default value of defaultRowPrefetch for Oracle

fields.description:
We just recognized that some issues disappear from software board if they are linked to an epic where the custom field Team is not set properly. Please find the details below.

JQL:

project in ("Project A", "Project B", "Project C", "Project D", "Project E") AND status != Deleted AND issuetype not in (Objective, Initiative) AND "Team" in ("Team A") ORDER BY Rank ASC

 

In the sprint view we can see all issues correctly but if we set the swimlane to epic, those issues disappear which are linked to epics where the Team is not 'A' although the issue itself should be listed on the board based on the above JQL.

It would be useful if these issues would be listed under the 'Issues without epic' section in the Active sprint view.

 

Thank you for considering!
fields.summary: Some issues are not visible on board when swimlane is set to epic

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
*SCIM* stands for System for Cross-domain Identity Management. A customer uses it to provision users on another system. For example, this is currently used by Slack and Zoom to create user accounts when a new user is created, and to deprovision accounts when the user account is disabled or deleted.

The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) specification is designed to make managing user identities in cloud-based applications and services easier. The specification suite seeks to build upon experience with existing schemas and deployments, placing specific emphasis on simplicity of development and integration, while applying existing authentication, authorization, and privacy models. Its intent is to reduce the cost and complexity of user management operations by providing a common user schema and extension model, as well as binding documents to provide patterns for exchanging this schema using standard protocols. In essence: make it fast, cheap, and easy to move users in to, out of, and around the cloud.
More details can be found at http://www.simplecloud.info/

h3. Suggested Solution
Support SCIM 2.0 implementation in Jira as a server. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Use 3rd party Apps which implement this.
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want Jira to support SCIM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the *Group Object Filter* attribute in the external directory connector is used to filter out a group, this group is deleted from Jira.

However, it there's a project role or permission scheme using this group, it is not updated and the group is still visible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect an external directory and sync groups
 # Add the group to a permissions scheme. 
 # Add the group to a project role. 
 # Filter out the group so it doesn't get sync'd
 # Verify the group is deleted from Jira by the next sync
 # View the permissions scheme. 
 # View the project role. 

h3. Expected Results
Deleted group shouldn't show in the permissions scheme nor in the project role. 
h3. Actual Results
Deleted group still shows in the the permissions scheme and the project role. 
 +*Notes*+
If the deleted group is local, it will also be deleted from he permissions scheme and the project role. 

h3. Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Filtering out a group from an external directory does not remove it from project roles and permissions schemes
External system import (Csv/Json) does not write change history when clearing a custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Even on an upgrade or on a fresh install of Jira 8.12.3, when we to access the  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/files/951394526/951394527/1/1527598493234/cog_icon.png|width=23,height=23! > System > Plugin Data Storage page, it doesn't return any plugin information, instead, it brings all plugins name as *unknown*, table column as *'$i.table'* and rows as *'$i.rows'.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Fresh install of Jira 8.12.3 or 8.13
 * Upgrade to 8.12.3 or 8.13 version of Jira

Try to access the  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/files/951394526/951394527/1/1527598493234/cog_icon.png|width=23,height=23! > System > Plugin Data Storage page
h3. Expected Results

This page expected to have all Jira's plugin information
h3. Actual Results

We have these results on the Plugin Data Store page -

Database Tables
 Plugin Table Rows
 <unknown> 
 $i.table
 $i.rows
 <unknown> 
 $i.table
 $i.table
 $i.table
 $i.table
 $i.rows
 $i.rows
 $i.rows
 $i.rows
 <unknown> 
 $i.table
 $i.rows
h3. Workaround

If you need information on the DB tables for the most common Jira apps, please review [List of Jira Server AO table names and vendors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/list-of-jira-server-ao-table-names-and-vendors-973498988.html].

Otherwise, you can perform these steps to restore the functionality in Jira:
 # Edit *<jira-install-dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/velocity.properties*
 # Replace the full line containing *com.atlassian.activeobjects* from the *introspector.restrict.packages* section with: 
{code:java|bgColor=#f8f8f8}
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.ao,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.config,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.plugin,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.servlet,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.spring,\
 com.atlassian.activeobjects.util,\ {code}

 # Replicate the same change in *<jira-install-dir>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/velocity-static.properties*
 # Restart Jira

(!) Bear in mind that these changes were made in order to limit potential template injection vulnerabilities, so there are some security implications to this workaround. You might consider making this change, getting the data you need from the page, and then reverting it and restarting Jira again.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When removing an Issue Type from an Issue Type Scheme, Jira will need to perform a migration task for all issues of that Issue Type in the Projects that use that Issue Type Scheme.

As of Jira 8.0.0, it is possible to archive specific issues in a Data Center environment, per [Archiving an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/archiving-an-issue-968669980.html], which prevents them from being searchable and edited.

When an Issue Type is removed from an Issue Type Scheme, and there are *archived* issues of that Issue Type in a project that uses that Issue Type Scheme, the entire migration will fail, as *archived* issues cannot be edited, and thus cannot be migrated to a different issue type.

However, the administrator will receive an unhelpful error that does not explain that the root cause of the migration failure is due to an archived issue, and instead receives the following message:
{quote}You do not have the correct permissions to move the issues from project Software for issue type Bug{quote}
 !image-2020-10-23-14-22-05-234.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any project, archive an issue. Note that issue's Issue Type.
# Attempt to remove that Issue Type from the Issue Type Scheme for the project

h3. Expected Results

A clear error explaining that archived issues exist for the Issue Type being moved is shown.

h3. Actual Results

The Administrator receives this error, suggesting that the problem relate to project permissions:

{quote}You do not have the correct permissions to move the issues from project Software for issue type Bug{quote}

h3. Workaround

Since there are no project permissions that can control someones ability to move only issues of *specific* issue types, if the administrator can verify that they have the ability to migrate *other* issue types and just not certain affected ones, then it is likely that archived issues are the culprit. They may then unarchive the issues in order to proceed.
fields.summary: Removing an Issue Type from an Issue Type Scheme when there exists archived issues of that type shows incorrect error
Importing issues into Jira allows the creation of new Epic Statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JRASERVER-17783 introduced a feature that enable users to edit others' dashboard. But specifying user and group as editors do not enable the user to edit the shared dashboard/filter but adding them to a group having global permission "Create Shared Objects" does the same
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as an admin user
 Create 2 normal users named 'edit.user' and 'share.user'. Both are in group 'jira-users' which gives general access to Jira.
 # Add 'share.user' to another group "jira-servicedesk-users", that is assigned to the global permission "Create Shared Objects".
 # Login as 'Share.user' and create a new dashboard. Add 'jira-users' as viewers and edit.user as editor.
 # Login as 'edit.user'. The shared dashboard looks like this for user 'edit.user': dash_view_edit.user.png. 'edit.user' should be able to edit this dashboard but cannot.
 # user 'edit.user' is added to the group "jira-servicedesk-users" and reloads the dashboard. Then 'edit.user' can edit. (see: dash_view_edit.user_plus_global_perm.png)

{noformat}
Additional scenario:
The same behavior is reproducible with shared filters.
{noformat}
h3. Expected Results

When 'share.user' sets view + edit group to 'jira-users' for the shared dashboard, 'edit.user' should be able to edit the dashboard.
h3. Actual Results

Only when edit.user is added to the group having the global perm "Create Shared Objects" editing is possible.
fields.summary: Global permission "Create Shared Objects" enables a user to edit shared Dashboard/Filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Add watchers" option is visible for users who do not have "Manage Watchers" permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project. Add a user to the project (non admin).
 # Remove "Manage Watchers" permission for the added user.
 # Login as 'user'. Create a new Issue. After issue is created "Add Watchers" option will not be visible for the user, which is as expected.
# Access the same issue through *Projects > Project > Issues > Issue number*, the "Add watchers" option will be visible for the agent even if the user does not have 'Manage Watchers' permission. 
(i) However, the user will not be able to add any watchers, and an error message will be displayed as the agent/user does not have "Manage Watchers" permission.

But, having the "Add watchers" option for user even if user is not having any permission leads to confusion.

h3. Expected Results
"Add watchers" option should not be displayed for 'user' who do not have 'Manager Watchers' permission. This should be the case when issue is accessed through any method.

h3. Actual Results
Access the issue through *Projects > Project > Issues > Issue number*, the "Add watchers" option will be visible for the agent even if user does not have 'Manage Watchers' permission. 


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Add watchers" option is visible for users who do not have "Manage Watchers" permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating an option value with more than 255 characters at a "Select List (single choice)" custom field, a 500 error page is exhibited.
The issue happens because the value exceeds the size from column "customvalue" of the table "customfieldoption".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a "Select List (single choice)" custom field with any option value.
# At the Jira Custom Fields management page (Administration > Issues > Custom fields), click at the Actions > Configure button for the newly created custom field.
# At the bottom of the page, click at the "Edit Options" link.
# Try to add a new Custom Field Option or edit one that already exists using a text field with more than 255 characters.
# A 500 error page will occur when trying to save the value


h3. Expected Results

There should be a filter at the UI for these fields, limiting the field up to 255 characters.

h3. Actual Results

A 500 error message containing the text below:

{code:java}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO customfieldoption (ID, CUSTOMFIELD, CUSTOMFIELDCONFIG, PARENTOPTIONID, SEQUENCE, customvalue, optiontype, disabled) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'customvalue' at row 1)
{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a custom field option value with more than 255 characters results on a 500 error page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In some cases Jira is not able to run properly due to file or directory permission error, this is usually caused by running Jira services as a different user before the normal run.
Having full write access to the <Jira_Home> and some folders in the <Jira_Install> are required for normal operations

Example of errors:
* Example1
{noformat}
2020-09-28 22:25:16,090+0000 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] 
    
    ****************
    Jira starting...
    ****************
    
log4j:ERROR setFile(null,true) call failed.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /disk/data/atlassian/application-data/jira/log/atlassian-jira.log (Permission denied)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open0(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(FileOutputStream.java:270)
	...
{noformat}
* Example2
{noformat}
2020-09-28 22:25:32,838+0000 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.jira.startup.ComponentContainerLauncher] A fatal error occurred during initialisation. JIRA has been locked.
com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.OsgiContainerException: Unable to clean the cache directory: /disk/data/atlassian/application-data/jira/plugins/.osgi-plugins/felix
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.impl.DefaultOsgiPersistentCache.validate(DefaultOsgiPersistentCache.java:71)
	...
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to list contents of /disk/data/atlassian/application-data/jira/plugins/.osgi-plugins/felix
{noformat}

See also related KB [How to fix directory permissions in Linux for Jira Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-directory-permissions-in-linux-for-jira-server-829048437.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add a file system permission to validate permission before starting the Tomcat/Java 

 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want Jira to check if it's run with correct user permission

fields.description:
AWS Secrets Manager allows to rotate the password used for database connectivity on a regular interval without human interaction. There is no such feature implemented in Jira. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Create an integration between Jira and the AWS Secrets Manager to update the database password automatically.

AWS provides a reference JDBC implementation that intercepts calls to the driver and replaces credentials on the fly. The examples provided use C3P0 (which Jira does not use), so I'm not sure if it's applicable - [https://github.com/aws/aws-secretsmanager-jdbc]
h3. Suggested workaround

AWS Secrets Manager has a API that permits to use scrips to connect to it and collect the new password. A possible workaround would be:
 # Create a script to get the new password from the AWS Secrets Manager as described in this page: [How to use AWS Secrets Manager to rotate credentials for all Amazon RDS database types, including Oracle|https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/security/how-to-use-aws-secrets-manager-rotate-credentials-amazon-rds-database-types-oracle/]
 # Use the script to update the password retrieve from the AWS to update the database password in JIRA_INSTALL/conf/dbconfig.xml
 # Finally, use the script to restart the Jira
fields.summary: Automatic password rotation for AWS Secrets Manager

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding '#' '&' '+' into More -> Link -> Advanced Search causes invalid JQL error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a label to an issue such as "Label_1&2_test", "Label_1#2_test" or "Label_1+2_test"
 # On another issue click More -> Link
 # Click 'Search for an Issue'
 # Click 'Advanced Search"
 # type one of the below JQL:
 ## labels = "Label_1&2_test"
 ## labels = "Label_1#2_test"
 ## labels = "Label_1+2_test"

I tested this specifically with labels, but other features may also be impacted. Removing the '#' '&' '+' character will allow the JQL to run.
h3. Expected Results

A list of issues
h3. Actual Results

Invalid JQL error.
h3. Workaround

1. Avoid using these characters for searching on this screen where possible.

2. When Searching for projects with special characters on their names, search with the Project key instead.

3. If unable to avoid special characters, check what is the special character equivalent in the %# format, to use it instead. Steps:
 # Go to *Search > Search for an issue* and run the JQL
 # The URL will convert the special characters into a "%" followed by two hexadecimal digits.
 In this case, "&"converts to "%26"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Use the converted character to search on the *Issue Link* advanced search, using the *in* clause.
{code:java}
project in ("Victoria %26 Charlie"){code}

(i) You may use the search URL as a reference for special character conversion, or refer to the [HTML URL Encoding Reference|https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.ASP] page.
fields.summary: Adding '#' '&' '+' into More -> Link -> Advanced Search causes invalid JQL error.

Remove the deprecated jar files manually.

fields.description:
With SAML, we added a custom multi-valued user attribute in G Suite as described in the article below to represent groups the user belongs to:https://support.google.com/a/answer/6208725?hl=en

This helped work around the mandatory Groups field in the JIT provisioning settings and allowed us to authenticate successfully with a local account being provisioned automatically. However manually duplicating the list of groups a user belongs to in a custom G suite attribute is a lot of overhead when we consider doing this for hundreds of users. It's also error prone (groups have to be typed in, not selected from a list when adding to the custom attribute) and is also a security risk (eg: not removing the group name from the custom attribute when the user's been removed from the Google group could result in a user still having access to resources they're not supposed to have access to). We also reached out to Google to see whether there's a way to fetch the actual Google groups as an attribute, however they said it's not possible at this time and that the application needs to fetch the group information using the Directory API (please see here: https://developers.google.com/admin-sdk/directory/v1/reference/groups/list). Is supporting G Suite as an IdP in the SSO settings using this mechanism something we can request as a feature?
fields.summary: Support for JIT Gsuite.

fields.description:
This issue for adding support to Jira for Postgresql, which was released 9/24/2020.

It would be much appreciated if support could be added to other server/data center products (e.g. Confluence) at around the same time. As a customer, being able to run each Atlassian product on the same database version reduces complexity, maintenance cost and ultimately the cost of ownership for Atlassian tools.

Having support available for more recent versions of postgresql gives us more flexibility in scheduling upgrades and gets us using newer versions more quickly -- instead of waiting an indeterminate amount of time for Atlassian to add support for it, and only then being able to upgrade.
fields.summary: Support for Postgresql 13
